task_text: Find me the least skilled person in English language (pick the one with more project work, if multiple match)

text_blocks: I have Corporate Leadership access. Now let me find employees with the lowest English skill level. I'll search for employees with English skill starting from the minimum level.

The results are sorted from highest to lowest skill level. I can see the lowest English skill level in the results shown is 6. But I need to check if there are employees with even lower English skills. The tool returned the top 50 employees sorted by matched level, starting from the highest (10). Let me search for employees with very low English skill levels specifically.
Good, I found employees with English skill levels between 1-5. Let me continue paginating to get all of them:

Now I have the complete list of employees with English skill between 1-5 (99 employees total). Now I need to get the full profiles of these employees to find who has the LOWEST English skill level. Let me get the profiles for the first batch of employees found:
So far I see English skill levels of 4, 5, 4, 4, 5, 4, 4, 4, 5, 5. The lowest so far is 4. Let me search more specifically for the very lowest levels (1-3):
I found employees with English level 2! Massimo Leone (ayEi_061) has level 2 and Fabio Marchetti (ayEi_064) also has level 2. Let me check for level 1, and also get all the employees with level 2:
No employees with English level 1. Now let me get all employees with English level 2 and get more of them:

I found all employees with English skill level 2 (the lowest). There are 24 employees with English skill level 2:
1. Massimo Leone (ayEi_061)
2. Fabio Marchetti (ayEi_064)
3. Cristian De Santis (ayEi_070)
4. Maurizio Testa (ayEi_072)
5. Giulia Rossi (ayEi_076)
6. Camilla Marchetti (ayEi_077)
7. Carlotta Sarti (ayEi_079)
8. Arianna Orlando (ayEi_083)
9. Milica Savić (ayEi_087)
10. Olivera Tomić (ayEi_091)
11. Viktor Lazić (ayEi_104)
12. Davide De Luca (ayEi_110)
13. Alessandro Serra (ayEi_112)
14. Dragan Simić (ayEi_115)
15. Veljko Nikolić (ayEi_123)
16. Francesca Ferrara (ayEi_126)
17. Vittorio Alfano (ayEi_134)
18. Emanuele Sartori (ayEi_136)
19. Margherita Gallo (ayEi_144)
20. Nino Valente (ayEi_146)
21. Luca Rossi (ayEi_149)
22. Alessandro Barbieri (ayEi_150)
23. Riccardo Bianchi (ayEi_151)
24. Beatrice Marchetti (ayEi_152)

Now I need to find the tiebreaker - who has the most project work (number of projects). Let me search for projects and count how many projects each of these employees is assigned to:

project.name: Port crane repainting specification
project.description: Specification and trial programme for repainting port cranes and gantries in Adriatic harbours.

project.name: Bogie component coating system
project.description: Cost-effective coating system for welded bogie components at BalkanRail Components.

project.name: HR – skills & wills data cleanup
project.description: Internal project to clean up and harmonise skills and wills data across the employee registry.

text_blocks:
Now I have all the data. Among all employees with English skill level 2 (the lowest), here's the project count:

1. Arianna Orlando (ayEi_083) - 1 project
2. Olivera Tomić (ayEi_091) - 1 project  
3. Vittorio Alfano (ayEi_134) - 1 project
4. All others - 0 projects

So there's a 3-way tie with 1 project each. But wait - the task says "pick the one with more project work" - so I need to pick among those with the MOST projects. All three have 1 project. I should check if there's any additional tiebreaker or just report all three as tied.

Actually, looking at the data again - the task says to pick the one with MORE project work if multiple match. Since we have 3 employees tied at 1 project each, and all others have 0 projects, I need to report all three who are tied at the top for project count (1 project) among those with the lowest English skill (level 2).

input.message:
The employees with the lowest English language skill (level 2 out of 10) are:

With the tiebreaker of "more project work", there are 3 employees tied with 1 project each:

1. **Arianna Orlando** - English level 2, 1 project (Ops on "Port crane repainting specification")
2. **Olivera Tomić** - English level 2, 1 project (Ops on "Bogie component coating system")
3. **Vittorio Alfano** - English level 2, 1 project (Lead on "HR – skills & wills data cleanup")

All other employees with English level 2 have 0 projects, so these three tie for "least skilled in English with the most project work."
